title: Universal failure in ipython (master affected)
body:
It doesn't matter which command I run (PY2 and PY3), in ipython the all end with (common part of traceback):

````
/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git/datalad/cmd.pyc in run(self, cmd, env, *args, **kwargs)
    581     def run(self, cmd, env=None, *args, **kwargs):
    582         return super(GitRunner, self).run(
--> 583             cmd, env=self.get_git_environ_adjusted(env), *args, **kwargs)
    584 
    585 

/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git/datalad/cmd.pyc in run(self, cmd, log_stdout, log_stderr, log_online, expect_stderr, expect_fail, cwd, env, shell, stdin)
    409                                         cwd=cwd or self.cwd,
    410                                         env=popen_env,
--> 411                                         stdin=stdin)
    412 
    413             except Exception as e:

/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.pyc in __init__(self, args, bufsize, executable, stdin, stdout, stderr, preexec_fn, close_fds, shell, cwd, env, universal_newlines, startupinfo, creationflags)
    380         (p2cread, p2cwrite,
    381          c2pread, c2pwrite,
--> 382          errread, errwrite), to_close = self._get_handles(stdin, stdout, stderr)
    383 
    384         try:

/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.pyc in _get_handles(self, stdin, stdout, stderr)
    832             else:
    833                 # Assuming file-like object
--> 834                 errwrite = stderr.fileno()
    835 
    836             return (p2cread, p2cwrite,

/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ipykernel/iostream.pyc in fileno(self)
    357 
    358     def fileno(self):
--> 359         raise UnsupportedOperation("IOStream has no fileno.")
    360 
    361     def write(self, string):

UnsupportedOperation: IOStream has no fileno.
````

Actual action is performed without failure. Output delivery seems to interact in an unfortunate way with ipython setup.

Can you replicate this? @bpoldrack @yarikoptic
